channel.title: Worth the purchase?
channel.description:
http://www.argos.ie/static/Product/partNumber/9255777/c_1/1%7Ccategory_root%7CVideo+games%7C14419738/c_2/2%7Ccat_14419738%7CPS3%7C14419785/c_3/3%7Ccat_14419785%7CPS3+accessories%7C14419800.htm
I'm considering buying that headset, but I am just wondering is it worth it? I am asking you guys as I have never really purchased a headset and some of you may have. If you've any suggestions, please do post them.

item.title: Worth the purchase?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“pure2ownage, post:7, topic:366505”][quote author=Si Force link=topic=462710.msg3385127#msg3385127 date=1288390115]

I’m not sure if this is relevant/helps, but I’ve had the Turtle Beach x3 headset for awhile and it’s amazing.

It’s very encouraging for me.

No it sucks and once you unpackage it and don’t like it Argosfaggots won’t take it back.

I’m aware that argos are faggots, but why do you say that the headset sucks?

[/quote]It isn’t worth the money spent on it and does not give any real advantages especially if you’re playing modern warfare2 in which half of the players use the Ninja Pro perk; and on most other games it has some bugs and problems with the sound increasement.[/quote]
Have you ever used X41’s?
You can literally hear people that use Ninja Pro, it’s a lot quieter but still there.

“Turtle Beaches” are the bomb, both my brother and I have them and they’re worth every penny. With MW2, seriously, sometimes I feel like I can close my eyes and still play the game, you don’t need to rely on your map and eyes and guessing (at where people are) when you can hear that well (every single footstep, anybody reloading, etc.). It’s actually like introducing a whole sense into gameplay that you never had before, and it really improves your ability to win games/etc. and the sense of direction is amazing. I frequently hear someone to the side/behind me and whip around to kill them. People have spectated me (like in Search and Destroy gametype) and saw me do something crazy like that and asked, “how did you know he was there?” to which I can simply respond, “Turtle Beaches”.

Read full topic

item.title: Worth the purchase?
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Basically, they’re equivalent to the Turtle beach x3’s, which are roughly the same price, which is an amazing headset. Regardless of what people in this topic are saying, if you’re going to be playing a first person shooter, like the call of the duty series, a headset like this makes the experience much better and much more fun. You’ll be able to tell alot sooner when and where people around you are coming from, you can easily hear what they are doing (for example in cod planting/defusing bombs can be heard from a reasonable distance away). Another great headset would be the Astro A40’s, which are a little bit more on the expensive side but obviously are a little bit better quality. Both are great gaming headsets and are strongly recommended for better gaming experiences.

Read full topic

item.title: Worth the purchase?

@djdoyle1 wrote:

Buy them from HMV for 49.99 they give you another pair if they break. They’re an amazing headphones. I got them, I never looked back (unless there was someone behind me)
